issues.description: Problem statement instructs students to access a public field 'children' directly via person.children, but both the template and the solution declare 'children' as a private field with accessor methods (getChildren()/setChildren()). If a student follows the problem text and tries to access person.children, their code will not compile and they will be blocked from implementing the intended functionality.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the artifacts consistent. Preferred fix: update the problem statement to instruct students to use the provided accessor (person.getChildren()) instead of direct field access. Alternative (less recommended): change the Person class to expose a public field 'children' to match the statement, but this weakens encapsulation and differs from the provided solution.

issues.description: The problem statement refers to the 'children list', suggesting a List type, but both the template and the solution model use a Set<Person> for the children collection. This wording may cause mild confusion about which collection type to use and which operations are appropriate.
issues.suggested_fix: Clarify the problem statement wording to refer to the 'children collection' or explicitly to a 'Set<Person>' (or update to 'children set') so it matches the Person class implementation and avoids confusion about allowed operations.

issues.description: The problem statement instructs students to access the children list directly via a public field (person.children), but both the template and solution define children as a private field with an accessor (getChildren()). This mismatch between the problem text and the code will mislead students: trying to access person.children will not compile and obscures the correct mapping to the provided Person.getChildren() API.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the problem statement with the code. Either (preferred) update the problem statement to instruct students to use the provided accessor (person.getChildren()) instead of person.children, or (if intentional) change the Person model to expose a public children field. Recommended: replace the sentence with: "Access the children list via person.getChildren() (use the getter) rather than assuming a public field."
